負.english_translation: To lose, to be defeated; burden, negative (kanji concept)

負ける.english_translation: To lose, to be defeated (in a competition or contest)

貯.english_translation: To save, to store, to accumulate (money or resources)

買いに行きませんか.english_translation: Won't you go shopping? (polite invitation to go buy something)

買える.english_translation: Can buy, affordable (potential form of 'to buy')

貸.english_translation: To lend, to rent out (with obligation to return)

貼.english_translation: To stick, to paste (attaching something to a surface with adhesive)

貼り.english_translation: Sticking, gluing; sticker (the act or the object itself)

賑.english_translation: Busy, bustling, lively (place with many people and activity)

賛.english_translation: Approval, support (agreeing with an opinion or action)

贈.english_translation: To give, to present (a gift, often formally)

贈り物.english_translation: Gift, present (item given as a sign of appreciation)

赤ん坊.english_translation: Baby, infant (a child who cannot walk yet)

走って.english_translation: Run (te-form, often used as a command or verb modifier)

起.english_translation: To wake up, to rise, to occur (kanji concept)

起す.english_translation: To wake someone up; to raise (transitive)

足す.english_translation: To add (to increase quantity or change flavor)

足りる.english_translation: To be enough, to suffice (meeting the required amount)

踊.english_translation: To dance (moving the body to music)

踊り.english_translation: Dance (movement of the body to music)

踊る.english_translation: To dance (moving the body to music)

踏む.english_translation: To step on, to tread on (putting foot on a surface)

車椅子.english_translation: Wheelchair (for mobility by people who cannot walk)

転職.english_translation: Changing jobs (to a different position or company)

載.english_translation: To place on, to publish, to appear (on a surface or in a medium)

辞典.english_translation: Dictionary (book with word meanings and spellings)

農.english_translation: Agriculture, farming (cultivation of crops and livestock)

込.english_translation: To be crowded, to be included (kanji concept)

込む.english_translation: To be crowded, to enter (a crowded place), to include

迎.english_translation: To welcome, to meet, to greet (someone arriving)

迎える.english_translation: To welcome, to receive (someone arriving, often with warmth)

近所.english_translation: Neighborhood, vicinity (nearby area with convenient facilities)

返.english_translation: To return, to reply (giving something back or answering)

返事.english_translation: Reply, answer (a response to a message or question)

述.english_translation: To state, to express (an opinion or information briefly)

迷.english_translation: To get lost, to be confused (losing one's way or clarity)

退院.english_translation: Discharge from hospital (patient leaving after treatment)

送.english_translation: To send, to see off (delivering something or accompanying someone)

送り.english_translation: Sending, seeing off (the act or a method)

送る.english_translation: To send (mail, gift, or email), to see off (a person)

逃.english_translation: To escape, to run away (kanji concept)

逃げる.english_translation: To run away, to escape (quickly, from danger or fear)

途中.english_translation: On the way, halfway (during a journey or process)

通う.english_translation: To commute, to frequent (regularly traveling to school/work)

通る.english_translation: To pass, to go through (a place or route without stopping)

連れる.english_translation: To take (someone) with you, to accompany

連絡.english_translation: Contact, communication (through calls, messages, or emails)

進.english_translation: To advance, to progress (moving forward toward a goal)

進む.english_translation: To advance, to move forward (towards a goal - intransitive)

遅れる.english_translation: To be late, to be delayed (missing a scheduled time)

遊.english_translation: To play, to enjoy oneself, to hang out (for fun/leisure)

遊び.english_translation: Play, recreation, fun (activity done for enjoyment)

運ぶ.english_translation: To carry, to transport (a heavy/large item from one place to another)

運動.english_translation: Exercise, movement, sport (physical activity for health/fitness)

過ぎる.english_translation: To pass, to exceed, to go too far (amount, time, or degree)

道具.english_translation: Tool, implement (item needed to complete a task)

遠く.english_translation: Far away, distant (at a long distance)

遠慮.english_translation: Reserve, modesty, holding back (polite refusal or hesitation)

適当.english_translation: Suitable, appropriate; careless, vague (depending on context)

選.english_translation: To choose, to select, to elect (kanji concept)

選び.english_translation: Choice, selection (the act of deciding on an option)

選ぶ.english_translation: To choose, to select (one option from several)

避.english_translation: To avoid, to evade, to take shelter (preventing problems)

邪.english_translation: Evil, wrong, corrupt (immorality or ill intent)

郊外.english_translation: Suburbs, outskirts (area outside the city center)

部長.english_translation: Department head, manager (head of a large department)

都.english_translation: Metropolis, capital (used in official names like Tōkyō-to)

配.english_translation: To distribute, to deliver; to worry (kanji concept)

金持ち.english_translation: Rich person, wealthy person (having a lot of money)

釣る.english_translation: To fish, to catch (with a fishing rod/line)

録.english_translation: Record, register, recording (saved audio or video)

鍛.english_translation: To forge, to temper, to train (metal or body)

長袖.english_translation: Long sleeves (clothing with sleeves reaching the wrist)

間.english_translation: Space, room; interval, duration (time between two events)

間に合う.english_translation: To be on time, to be in time (not being late for something)

間違える.english_translation: To make a mistake, to err (misunderstanding or incorrect answer)

関係.english_translation: Relationship, connection, concern (interaction that affects each other)

防.english_translation: Defense, protection, prevention (guarding against something unwanted)

降り出す.english_translation: To start raining/snowing (suddenly and often heavily)

限.english_translation: Limit, restriction (maximum amount, time, or size)

陸地.english_translation: Land (solid part of the Earth's surface, not covered by water)

隅.english_translation: Corner, nook (remote part of a space)

集.english_translation: To gather, to collect (people or things in one place)

集め.english_translation: Collection (the act or the items collected)

集める.english_translation: To collect, to gather (items of value or interest - transitive)

集る.english_translation: To gather, to assemble, to flock (in one place - intransitive)

雑草.english_translation: Weed, grass (wild plant that grows where not wanted)

雲.english_translation: Cloud (visible mass of water droplets/ice crystals in the atmosphere)

電子レンジ.english_translation: Microwave oven (appliance for quick food heating)

電灯.english_translation: Electric lamp, light bulb (on the ceiling/in the room)

電話します.english_translation: Will call (future polite form of 'to call')

需.english_translation: Demand, need, requirement (for a certain amount or condition)

非常に.english_translation: Extremely, very, highly (to a very high degree)

頼.english_translation: To rely on, to ask, to trust (dependence on someone's help)

顔.english_translation: Face (part of the head showing emotions/appearance)

飛び.english_translation: Flying, jumping (the act or a style)

飛行場.english_translation: Airfield, airport (place for planes to take off/land, often smaller)

食べませんか.english_translation: Won't you eat? / Would you like to eat? (polite invitation)

食べませんでした.english_translation: Did not eat (past negative polite form)

食べられる.english_translation: Can eat, edible (potential form of 'to eat')

食事.english_translation: Meal, dinner, eating (time when someone eats)

食料品.english_translation: Food items, groceries (products meant for eating)

飲みに行きませんか.english_translation: Won't you go for a drink? (polite invitation)

飲みませんでした.english_translation: Did not drink (past negative polite form)

飲める.english_translation: Can drink, drinkable (potential form of 'to drink')

飼.english_translation: To keep, to feed, to raise (animals)

飾る.english_translation: To decorate, to adorn (to make something look attractive)

首.english_translation: Neck; head; leader (part of the body or top part of something)

駐車場.english_translation: Parking lot, car park (designated area for parking vehicles)

騒ぐ.english_translation: To make noise, to be boisterous, to riot (lively or excited activity)

驚く.english_translation: To be surprised, to be astonished (strong reaction to something unexpected)

鮮.english_translation: Fresh, vivid (high quality and recent preparation or vibrant color)

鳴.english_translation: To make a sound, to ring, to chirp (kanji concept)

鳴き.english_translation: Sound, cry (made by animals, machines, or phenomena)

鳴る.english_translation: To sound, to ring (intransitive, bell, alarm, or bird's call)

鶏.english_translation: Chicken, fowl (domestic bird raised for eggs/meat)

麦.english_translation: Barley, wheat, grain (cereal grain used for food)
